Definition: In this task, you are given the body of a document and a title. The title is present in the document and refers to the entity mentioned in the document. The title might have some text in parentheses, for example: "HMS Mallow (K81)", or be slightly different from what is present in the text. If they still refer to the same entity, then it is a correct title. Indicate your answer as "Yes" if the title is correct, otherwise indicate your answer as "No".

Positive Examples.input:
Text: The Mansfield Building Society is a UK building society which has its headquarters in Mansfield Nottinghamshire. It is a member of the Building Societies Association. 
Title: Mansfield Building Society
Positive Examples.explanation: The title "Mansfield Building Society" is present in the text and it is the main entity that is referred in the text. Hence, it is the title of the document.

Positive Examples.input:
Text:  The third and current HMS Argyll is a Type 23 'Duke' Class frigate. She is currently the oldest serving Type 23 frigate in the Royal Navy. Like all of her class she is named for a British dukedom in this case that of Argyll. 
Title: HMS Argyll (F231)
Positive Examples.explanation: "HMS Argyll" is present in the text and it is the main entity that is referred in the text. Here, the text in parentheses "F31" is not present in the document and it can be ignored. Hence, the output is correct.

Negative Examples.input:
Text: The Mansfield Building Society is a UK building society which has its headquarters in Mansfield Nottinghamshire. It is a member of the Building Societies Association. 
Title: Mansfield Building Society
Negative Examples.explanation: The title "Mansfield Building Society" is present in the text and it is the main entity that is referred in the text. Hence, the output is incorrect.

Title: HMS Argyll (F231)
Negative Examples.explanation: The output should be either "Yes" or "No". Hence, it is negative example.

Much of his Sydney club career was with the St. 
Title: Together in Electric Dreams (album)

Text:  Early Abstractions is a collection of seven short animated films created by Harry Everett Smith between 1939 and 1956. Each film is between two and six minutes long and is named according to the chronological order in which it was made. 
Title: Early Abstractions

Text:  Javaher Deh (Persian: جواهرده‎ also Romanized as Javāher Deh) is a village in Sakht Sar Rural District in the Central District of Ramsar County Mazandaran Province Iran. At the 2006 census its population was 170 in 76 families. 
Title: Javaher Deh

Text:  Christ M. Stauffer (May 25 1896 - October 15 1963) was an American Republican member of the Wisconsin State Assembly in the late 1950s and early 1960s.

Text:  Perixera obliviaria is a species of moth of the Geometridae family. It is found from the Indo-Australian tropics east to Queensland and Fiji.The wingspan is about 30 mm. The wings are dull pale brown the hindwings with a small pale discal spot ringed darker brown to black.The larvae feed on Derris species. They are a pest in Citrus orchards. They attack the rind of the developing fruit of their host plant. 
Title: Bârsău River (Satulung)

Text:  Sinezona globosa is a species of minute sea snail a marine gastropod mollusk or micromollusk in the family Scissurellidae the little slit shells. 
Title: Natalie Burgener

Text:  EllisDon is an employee-owned global construction services company headquartered in Mississauga Ontario Canada. It maintains offices throughout Canada and two in the United Arab Emirates and also operates in the United States and the West Indies. Most projects are within Canada but it has worked on projects in distant locations like Latvia and Lithuania. 
Title: EllisDon

Text:  Mathematical Sciences Foundation (MSF) is an institute of education and research located in Delhi India. Its goal is the promotion of mathematics and its applications at all levels from school to college to research. 
Title: Mathematical Sciences Foundation
